page.title: 19PEAT DIGGING
page.content: MOST PEOPLE USED PEAT AS FUEL.HOUSES HAVE PEAT RIGHTS, THAT IS THE RIGHT TO CUT PEAT.SHETLAND HAS A DIFFERENT METHOD FROM OTHER PARTS OF THE COUNTRY.THIS IS THE METHOD USED IN OUR AREA.FIRST OF ALL YOU HAVE TO FLAE THE LAND WITH A RIPPER THAT IS DE TURF THE PEAT BANK THEN YOU HAVE TO CUT THE PEAT WITH A TUSHKAR,PILING THE PEAT INTO A WALL AND LEAVING IT TO DRY ENOUGH TO HANDLE.THE NEXT STAGE IS TO RAISE THEM INTO LITTLE PILES TO COMPLETE THE DRYING PROCESS.SOME PEOPLE TAKE THEM TO THEIR HOUSES IN A KISHIE, AN OLD STYLE BASKET. THE MODERN METHOD IS TAKING THEM HOME ON A TRACTOR AND TRAILER AND BUILDING A PEAT STACK CLOSE TO THE HOUSE.PEAT HAS A DISTINCTIVE SMELL AND IS USED WIDELY.INCLUDING PUTTING THE PEAT ON THE FIRE YOU SHOULD HAVE HANDLED EACH PEAT SEVEN TIMES.
